a management restructure involving long-time chief executive Eric Schmidt becoming executive chairman. Eric Schmidt , who has led Google since 2001, will take on the new role on April 4, working mostly on external operations, including deals, partnerships, customers and broader business relationships, government outreach and technology thought leadership. April 4, Google announced in an earnings release that the New York Times reported easily beat Wall Street's expectations. Google announced that Eric Schmidt will serve as executive chairman, advising Page and Google co-founder Sergey Brin and concentrating on deals, partnerships, customers, and broader business relationships, government outreach and technology thought leadership. In a short piece for Harvard Business Review, Eric Schmidt said Google's strategic initiatives are "all about mobile." In a new interview with ex "American Idol" judge Simon Cowell , Oprah Winfrey peels away a few layers from this complicated man she calls the world's most famous talent scout. The interview for her new network show called " Oprah Winfrey Presents Master Class" delves into Simon Cowell 's childhood and gives him a chance to reflect on why he has become so successful. decade. BGC Partners analyst Colin Gillis said Google experienced tremendous growth under Eric Schmidt , becoming a search and advertising powerhouse, but the company also arguably experienced a number of missteps and missed opportunities. A case can also be made that the company has not built any new material revenue streams, was late to building for the mobile market, has no effective social solutions, overbuilt its headcount and placed itself in the crosshairs of government regulators, Gillis said. Danny Sullivan , editor-in-chief of technology blog SearchEngineLand.com, said Google's biggest challenges now are to "prove that they've got their Mojo back and that nobody needs to fear them."
